p: The oleander is from 2 to 3 meters high. Its stems are glabrous and spread at the break a milky juice. The leaves are opposed by two or three, leathery, persistent, long lanceolate, and acute, with parallel veins, and tight on the stem. The flowers are pink, large, generally fragrant, and arranged in large terminal corymbs. The corolla is in saucer, with five petals welded by their base. The fruit is a follicle that sits in a cylindrical pod, and the seeds (which are rather infrequently formed) are hairy and have a feather [ 12].
